title: Hoopla 2013 Yountville Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: This soft wine is minimally oaky and combines quite ripe, figgy, almost honey-like fruit flavors with a vein of butter and almond. Fermented 90% in steel vats and 10% in oak barrels, it has a creamy texture and full body.

title: Kindzmarauli Marani 2014 Rkatsiteli (Kakheti)
description: This pale-straw-colored wine offers aromas of apricot and almond. It has good mouthfeel, smooth tannins, flavors of soft peach, toasted almond, vanilla and freesia, and a finish marked by flavors of almond paste and lemon zest.

title: Zolo 2014 Reserve Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)
description: Aromas of blackberry and briar patch expand to include violet notes. In the mouth, there's pulpy weight to the fruit and rubbery tannins for framing. Rugged but generic black-fruit flavors finish with toasty darkness and some burn.

title: Turasan 2014 Öküzgözü (Cappadocia)
description: Deep violet in the glass, this wine offers aromas of blackberry and raspberry infused with subtle earthy notes. It is surprisingly bright on the palate despite a rich tannic structure, with flavors of blueberry, cranberry and espresso.

title: Turasan 2015 Kalecik Karasi (Cappadocia)
description: This wine has a bouquet of raspberry, violet and apple peel. Dark red-violet in the glass, it is bright on entry, with flavors of cherry, cranberry, gala apple and violet. Tannins that are best described as sneaky take a back seat to bright acidity but make their presence known on the finish.

title: Chime 2013 Chardonnay (California)
description: Crisp green-apple freshness blends with hints of butter and vanilla for a nicely balanced, un-oaky, medium-bodied wine at a very reasonable price.

title: Christophe Cordier 2014 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Spicy, fruity and attractive, this balanced wine has acidity, tight minerality, yellow fruits and a richer texture. Full bodied and generous, it will age well. Drink from 2017.

title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2012 Herdade dos Machados Reserva Red (Alentejo)
description: A rich full wine that has swathes of black fruits. It has a dry core around which there are generous fruits and the right amount of acidity. Perfumed, ripe and concentrated, this is ready to drink now.

title: Cave des Vignerons de Buxy 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: This tangy wine has attractive acidity and a tightly coiled mineral texture. Apple and lemon flavors shoot right through the bright, crisp texture. Drink from 2017.

title: Chamlija 2014 Papaskarasi (Thrace)
description: From a winery that specializes in this rare variety, this single varietal Papaskarasi has a nose of cherry, strawberry and freesia. It is bright on entry, and then smooth tannins and a sense of coolness take over the palate among flavors of cherry, menthol, cranberry and juniper berry.

title: Château de Fuissé 2014  Saint-Véran
description: From vines in the northern part of the appellation, this ripe wine conveys peaches and apricots laced with lime. A vibrant, mineral wine with swathes of fresh acidity, it can be drunk now.

title: Château de Santenay 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet
description: This rich wine is full and has a good balance of acidity and fruit. The lightly mineral texture gives bite and crispness. It is still a young, tight wine needing another few months. Drink from 2017.

title: Broccardo 2012 I Tre Pais  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas of oak, toast and espresso that carry over to the firmly structured palate along with herb and dried black cherry. Austere tannins clench the finish.

title: Vinoterra 2014 Mtsvane (Kakheti)
description: Light-amber in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of apricot and nutmeg. It is nice in the mouth, with refreshing brightness and a soft sense of chalkiness. Flavors of apricot, peach, hazelnut and vanilla bean persist amid grippy tannins into the lingering finish.

title: Vinoterra 2014 Rkatsiteli (Kakheti)
description: This golden-honey-colored wine has a bouquet of green apple and toasted almonds. Bold tannins provide a backdrop for flavors of Gala apple, quince, orange peel and hazelnut that culminate in a brisk, tart finish.

title: Altocedro 2014 Año Cero Malbec (La Consulta)
description: Forced woody aromas and flavors are a persistent theme on this Uco Valley Malbec, which smells a bit horsey and stewed. Dense black-fruit flavors are roasted and peppery, while wood and related resin notes rise up on the back palate. Rustic power and fiery heat are loud elements on a fully oaked finish.

title: Anna Maria Abbona 2012  Barolo
description: Aromas of underbrush, Porcini mushroom and a hint of toast emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and mocha alongside assertive tannins.

title: Bailly-Lapierre NV La Burgondie Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Packed with red fruits and crisp acidity, this lively wine has a tight mousse, while the red-currant fruitiness adds intense acidity. The wine is bright and ready to drink.

title: Balo 2014 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Honeylike aromas, ripe peach and apple flavors and rather full body give this wine good depth and breadth. It seems like just the thing for a picnic or to serve with cheese at a party.

title: Bel Colle 2013 Montersino  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas suggesting dried rose petal, woodland berry, chopped mint and kitchen spice come together on this. The tight palate isn't quite as expressive as the nose, offering sour cherry, tart cranberry and a hint of clove alongside bracing tannins that grip the finish.

title: Beresford 2014 Beacon Hill Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)
description: Beyond a hint of stuck flint on the nose, this offers clean, varietally correct aromas and flavors of white nectarine, grapefruit and gooseberry. It's nicely balanced in the middle of the spectrum, offering a harmonious mix of stone fruit and citrus.

title: Boasso 2012 Margheria  (Barolo)
description: Underbrush, singed earth, mature dark-skinned fruit and a balsamic note emerge in the glass. The ripe, firm palate shows mocha, black raspberry and licorice as well as a slightly green note of raw sage. A backbone of bracing tannins provides the tight framework.

title: Pecchenino 2012 Le Coste di Monforte  (Barolo)
description: This opens with funky aromas of game, scorched soil, roasted herb and a whiff of barnyard. The palate is on the raw side, showing sour cherry and a sprinkling of white pepper framed in raspy tannins.

title: Obrigado 2015 Vera White (Vinho Verde)
description: A dry Vinho Verde with a light sparkle that give it a fine lift. With intense citrus and a sliced apple freshness, the wine is refreshing and ready to drink.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: Red fruit and wood are both prominent in this wine. A juicy red-currant character shows through the high-toast flavor. Attractive and fruity, it is likely to develop quickly. Drink this soft wine from 2018.

title: Rain Dance 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Riesling (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This is a bit awkward, with unresolved components of sour citrus, pineapple and generic green fruits. It finished dry, though there is a light sensation of finishing sweetness. A puzzler at the moment, it needs more time to pull together.

title: Rattalino 2013 Quarantatre  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting leather, grilled herb, stewed prune, mint and a whisper of exotic spice. On the palate, notes of star anise and chopped mint back up a core of dried black cherry while assertive, grainy tannins clench the astringent finish.

title: Ribafreixo 2015 Gáudio Alvarinho (Alentejano)
description: A lemon and ripe lime flavored that has attractive acidity and a riper, tropical fruit backdrop. It takes advantage of the relatively cool climate in Vidigueira to give a bright wine with a lightly perfumed aftertaste.

title: Salvano 2013  Barbaresco
description: This earthy wine opens with rather rustic aromas of leather, game, underbrush, tilled soil and ripe black skinned fruit. The no-frills palate offers dried black cherry, powdered herb and a hint of orange zest accompanied by solid, astringent tannins.

title: Secret Spot Wines 2015 Vale da Poupa Field Blend White (Douro)
description: The plateau above the Douro river is a fine place for white wine, cool and fresh at night. This wine is lemon flavored, lively with acidity and bright with tangy orange zest. It is ready to drink.
